results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 1
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Fox and the crow ; The Goose and the golden eggs ; The Ant and the grasshopper ; The Lion and the mouse ; The Horse and the laden donkey ; The Lion and the bulls and The Vain crow.

results.title: Aerodynamics: Forces acting on an air foil
results.brief_description: Explains the theory and principles of forces acting on air foils. Tells of the development and use of wind tunnels to measure forces on wing form.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Intermediate
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: The 30 minute Intermediate program has a more rigorous pace, and the exercises used are more demanding with fewer repetitions. The tape requires a good basic level of fitness, and assumes a level of flexibility and co-ordination such as would be developed through a consistent use of the Beginners Program. For many exercisers, and for elderly exercisers in particular, the intermediate program may be as far as they wish to go. Rated: G

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Beginners
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: The 30 minute “Beginners” program is at a gently demanding pace and is suitable for anyone who has not been actively involved in an exercise program within the past three months. Rated: G

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Advanced
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department and University of Western Australia
results.brief_description: For people seeking a high level of fitness, the 50 minute advanced tape offers a stimulating challenge. The exercises involved are complex, very demanding and require agility, flexibility, co-ordination and good aerobic fitness. Under no circumstances should this program be attempted before a suitable fitness level has been achieved with a thorough and regular fitness building program. The advanced program will not be attainable by all age groups; older exercisers will find the first two programs more suited to their requirements. Rated: G

results.title: Aerobic exercising
results.brief_description: Aerobic exercising is shown as a means to enhance lifestyle and increase lifespan. Emphasizes the need for sensible preparation for any fitness program including aerobics, as well as giving attention to safety aspects.

results.title: Aerial fencing
results.brief_description: With the opening up of new pastures in New Zealand many hundreds of miles of new fencing were required; aircraft which have been previously employed in distributing fertilizers, were used to drop fencing posts and wire. The materials were carried in racks under the wings of the planes and deposited in the areas required.

results.title: Aerial farming services in New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Alert Films and Soil Conservation and Rivers Control Council
results.brief_description: The use of aeroplanes in schemes for restoring eroded lands to former fertility by dropping fertilizers to improve pasture and poison to combat the rabbit menace. Shows Tiger Moth aircraft being fitted to spray chemical compounds; mechanical loading of fertilizer into planes; aircraft in flight and spraying from the air. Points out the saving in time and money that results from the use of aircraft.

results.title: Aerial attack on grass fires
results.brief_description: A trial demonstration was arranged at Orange, N.S.W., in which a Cessna plane carrying 75 gallons of water was used to find out what part light aircraft can play in fighting grass fires. Although the test was inconclusive it did show that a small plane would be of no use on a day of extreme fire danger.

results.title: Aeradio: the pilot's link to the ground
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Department of the Interior and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the Communications Officers - the men who keep a constant radio check on all aircraft in the air, maintaining voice or morse contact with the pilots, supplying information on weather conditions ahead, giving position, and acting, generally, as the pilot’s agent on the ground.
